document.docAuthor: Wesener, Thomas, Enghoff, Henrik & Sierwald, Petra
document.docTitle: Caprobolus andringitra Wesener & Enghoff & Sierwald 2009, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: Review of the Spirobolida on Madagascar, with descriptions of twelve new genera, including three genera of ' fire millipedes' (Diplopoda)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of the Spirobolida on Madagascar, with descriptions of twelve new genera, including three genera of ' fire millipedes' (Diplopoda)

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Field Museum of Natural History, 1400 S. Lake Shore Drive, Chicago, IL 60605, U. S. A. & Zoologisches Forschungsmuseum Alexander Koenig, Museumsmeile Bonn, Adenauerallee 160, D- 53113 Bonn, Germany. & B 54 D 3623309

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined:
6 ♂, 1 imm.
Holotype :
1 ♂ ( 41 mm long), FMNH-INS 13601 , Madagascar , Province Fianarantsoa , Andringitra reserve , camp 3, 40 km S Ambalavao , along Volotsangana River , rainforest,
1210 m
, 22°13’22’’ S , 46°58’18’’ E , leg. S. Goodman ,
5–6.XII.1993
.
Paratypes :
3 ♂, 1 imm. , FMNH-INS 13600 , same data as holotype
;
1 ♂, FMNH-INS 13611 , same data as holotype
;
2 ♂, FMMC 8219 , RS Ivohibe ,
900 m
, rainforest, 22°25’ S , 46°56 ‘E , leg. S. Goodman ,
7–12.X.1997
.

Other material examined
: 1 ♂, CASENT 9032814, Province Fianarantsoa , Forêt de Vevembe, 66.6 km 293°WNW Farafangana, rainforest in transition to montane rainforest, 600 m , 22°47’28” S , 47°10’55” E , leg. B. L. Fisher et al., yellow pan trap, 23.IV.2006

Description .
Measurements : male holotype with 44 rings, circa 41 mm long, 3.2 mm wide. Male paratypes with 43 or 44 rings (specimen from Vevembe with 46), up to 44 mm long, up to 3.5 mm wide.

Coloration faded in alcohol. Head, legs and antennae orange-red ( Figs 39 A–D). Anal valves and subanal scale reddish, preanal process greyish ( Fig. 39C ). Metazonites red, remaining parts of body rings up to ozopore openings orange-reddish, more dorsally greyish. Specimens dorsally with a slender, orange line.
Collum: smooth, not protruding as far as body ring 2 ( Fig. 39A ).

Body rings: mostly smooth, with some irregular punctation and some transverse impressions on mesozona. Ozopores starting at ring 6, touching suture between mesozona and metazona. Ozopore on ring 6 located more ventrally than subsequent ozopores.
Telson : anal valves with well-developed lips and micropunctation. Preanal ring and subanal process well-rounded, not extending beyond anal valves ( Fig. 39C ).

Etymology :
andringitra
, noun in apposition, after the type locality, the Andringitra mountain massive.
